pages.text:
Contact Us:
Address​
381 Orange Lane, Casselberry, Florida 32707
The club is not open daily.
We are only open for published events.  See the Home page or
Events page
for a list of upcoming events.
Please email for the fastest response (complete the inquiry form below)
NOTE: This is a cultural club, not a hotel.
If you prefer to call, please leave a message with your name, email address and phone number. NOTE: we will be calling you back using a different phone number than our club number, so please check your messages.   We typically respond within 2 days. If you don't hear back, please email us instead. Thank you.
407-834-0574  (not the best way to reach us!)

Members – this form is not for dinner reservations. Please go to the Member Login page to make your reservation.

Events and Festivals
Festivals – Oktoberfest and Springtoberfest
What is Karneval/Fasching?
Dancing
,
Dinner Dance
,
Event Calendar
,
Events and Festivals
,
German Food
,
Learn More
,
Music
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
People who like to dress up in fancy dresses or costumes can do it through February 28 of each year, as Germany celebrates its “fifth season” or “crazy season.” Different areas in Germany have different names for this season of disguise, being crazy and wild and having fun. In the Pfalz region it’s called “Fassenacht” […]
What is Karneval/Fasching?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content

#post-##
What is Narrensitzung?
Dancing
,
Dinner Dance
,
Events and Festivals
,
German Food
,
Learn More
,
Music
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Join in the craziness of Mardi Gras German Style at Narrensitzung – held in January each year. This event, called Narrensitzung or session of fools and jesters, will feature an evening of fun, humor, merry making, sing-alongs and music and dance. Mardi Gras is a Christian holiday and popular cultural phenomenon that dates back thousands
What is Narrensitzung?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content

#post-##
What is a Lumpenball?
Dinner Dance
,
Events and Festivals
,
German Food
,
Learn More
,
Music
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
What is a Lumpenball? In German, Lumpen is translated as “rags” or “Ragamuffin”…. and a Ball is, well, a Ball, with dancing. A Lumpenball, in translation, is a Ragamuffin Ball or a Hobo Ball. The idea is to attend these balls AFTER Fasching, since you spent all of your money on costumes, drinking and partying,
What is a Lumpenball?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content
.blog-layout-1
#post-##
What is a Trachtenfest?
Clothing
,
Dancing
,
Events and Festivals
,
German Food
,
Learn More
,
Music
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
A trachtenfest is a festival where traditional German costumes are worn, such as dirndl for women and lederhosen for men. A dirndl is a feminine dress originating in German speaking areas of the Alps. It is traditionally worn by women and girls in Bavaria (which is Southeastern Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Liechtenstein and Alpine regions of
What is a Trachtenfest?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content

#post-##
What is Heimatabend ?
Clothing
,
Dancing
,
Dinner Dance
,
Events and Festivals
,
Learn More
,
Music
,
Party
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
An evening of traditional German food, song and dance!  Held every February at the German American Society of Central Florida. Join us for our annual Heimatabend featuring dance music for everyone from German polkas and waltzes to Latin and pop. Wear your Tracht to this fun-filled evening with lots of dancing, good music, good refreshment,
What is Heimatabend ?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content
.blog-layout-1
#post-##
What is Schlagerabend?
Dancing
,
Dinner Dance
,
Events and Festivals
,
German Food
,
Learn More
,
Music
,
Party
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Schlagerabend is a German party featuring music, dancing and German food.  Schlager means hit music.  Abend means evening. Join us for an evening of International Schlager Hit music performed by renowned singer, Eva Adams. Her musical repertoire covers five decades of hits, including English, German, Spanish, Czech and Slovak songs. Sing along to your favorite
What is Schlagerabend?
Read More »

What is Bratwurst?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Bratwurst The name “Bratwurst” is a sausage made from pork in a natural casing and then grilled or fried in a pan. It is a favorite in Germany, and each region has its own specialty. Some Bratwurst are sold raw, while others are sold pre-cooked. It is important to know this so that they are […]
What is Bratwurst?
Read More »

.post-content

#post-##
How to Pour Beer Like Germans!
German Food
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
What are you drinking? The way you pour beer depends on what you’re drinking.  There are three types of beer: lager, pilsner, and wheat beer (weissbier – there are 3 of them, some with more yeast than others), and each one of them is poured differently. The foam You want a nice head with German
How to Pour Beer Like Germans!

What is an Auerhahn?
Animals
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
The Auerhahn (in German) is a bird called the western capercaillie, also known as the Eurasian capercaillie, wood grouse, heather cock or cock-of-the-woods.  It is a heavy member of the grouse family and the largest of all grouse species.
What is an Auerhahn?

What is Glühwein?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
What is Glühwein? Popular at German Christmas markets, and holiday gatherings, this is a mulled wine, with a different twist. Glühwein is traditionally served at stalls at Christmas markets across Germany and Austria to keep people warm as they shop and socialize. German Glühwein, literally translates to glow-wine, because of how you feel after you’ve
What is Glühwein?

.post-content

What is Pfeffernüsse?
German Food
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
What does Pfeffernüsse mean in German?  The name literally means “peppernuts”, and does not mean it contains nuts. The cookies are roughly the size of nuts and can be eaten by the handful, which may account for the name. German for “pepper nut“, Pfeffernüsse are named for the pinch of pepper added to the dough
What is Pfeffernüsse?

What is Stollen?
German Food
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Stollen is a traditional German Christmas fruit bread, made of nuts, spices, and dried or candied fruit, coated with powdered sugar or icing sugar and often containing marzipan (a delicious almond paste!). During the Christmas season it is also called Weihnachtsstollen or Christstollen. The most common Stollen is Dresdener Stollen from the city of Dresden,
What is Stollen?

What is German Potato Salad?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
German potato salad varies!  Most people think that all German potato salad is served warm, but that’s only one variety.  Here, we’ll look at the three types of German potato salad. Pick your favorite! German Potato Salad is made from potatoes that have less starch in them, because they keep their shape better after cooking.
What is German Potato Salad?

What are Potato Pancakes?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Potato pancakes are shallow fried pancakes made out of grated or ground potato, with an egg and onion.  They are topped with applesauce or sour cream or they can be served plain.  Everyone loves them! What’s the difference between potato pancakes and latkes?  They both use potatoes and eggs as the main ingredients. Latkes also
What are Potato Pancakes?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content
.blog-layout-1
#post-##
What is Strudel?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Strudel is a layered pastry with a sweet filling, like apples.  It became popular in the Hapsburg Empire in the 18th century.  The word comes from the German word which literally means “whirlpool”. A pastry dough is rolled or stretched thin, then filled and rolled up.  Strudel is often served with vanilla ice cream.  It
What is Strudel?

German Last Names
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Ever wonder what German last names really mean and where they came from? Here is a list of the origins of some German names, usually tied to occupations or attributes. German Last Names and Meanings Albrecht Noble Bauer Farmer or peasant Beck Living near a stream or brook Becker Baker Berger Someone who comes from

Oktoberfest Song Fliegerlied
Learn More
,
Music
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Fliegerlied (So ein schöner Tag) If you’ve been to an Oktoberfest, then you’ll recognize this famous Oktoberfest song!  Learn the words below and get ready to party! Fliegerlied  (German words – English below) Ich lieg gern im Gras Und schau zum Himmel rauf Schauen die ganzen Wolken Nicht lustig aus? Und fliegt en Flieger vorbei

What is Bienenstich?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Bienenstich is a German cake made primarily out of sweet bread, vanilla custard filling and honey-glazed sliced-almond topping. Bienenstich means “bee sting” in German. One source for the origin of bienenstich cites a legend of German bakers from the 15th century who lobbed beehives at raiders from a neighboring village, successfully repelling them, and celebrated
What is Bienenstich?

.post-content

What is Spatzle?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Spätzle is a German egg noodle pasta with a chewy, dumpling-like texture. The short noodles are usually irregularly shaped and made from a batter of eggs mixed with flour and milk or water. What is Spatzle? Spätzle is a classic dish for those living in the Baden-Württemberg and Bavaria states in the Southern region
What is Spatzle?

What is Goulash?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
German goulash is a hearty beef stew, seasoned with onion, paprika and caraway seeds. It is a simple, rich and comforting one pot meal that’s great over egg noodles, mashed potatoes or spaetzle. What cut of meat is goulash?   The cut you need is flank or chuck. Flank is from the lower half of the
What is Goulash?

What is Kasseler Rippchen?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
What is Kasseler Rippchen? Kassler Rippchen are bone-in pork chops that have been cured in a salt brine and smoked, but not cooked. The process of smoking meat and then letting it ripen in a salt brine is known as “Kasseler.” In Germany, this process is used on other cuts of pork, not just the
What is Kasseler Rippchen?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content
.blog-layout-1
#post-##
What is Sauerbraten?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
Sauerbraten is a traditional German roast of heavily marinated meat. It is regarded as a national dish of Germany, and is frequently served in German-style restaurants internationally. It can be prepared from a variety of meats, most often from beef, but also from venison, lamb and pork. What cut of beef for sauerbraten? A rump
What is Sauerbraten?
Read More »
.entry-content .clear
.post-content
.blog-layout-1
#post-##
What is Schnitzel?
German Food
,
Learn More
/ By
GASOCF2
.entry-header
What is Schnitzel?   Schnitzel is a tender slice of meat, pounded thin, then breaded and fried, giving it a crispy coating. The dish’s name comes from the German word “schnitt,” which translates to “cut.” The most popular type of meat for schnitzel is veal (wiener-schnitzel) or pork (schweine-schnitzel), but there are also varieties made
What is Schnitzel?

Sauerbraten is a traditional German roast of heavily marinated meat. It is regarded as a national dish of Germany, and is frequently served in German-style restaurants internationally. It can be prepared from a variety of meats, most often from beef, but also from venison, lamb and pork. What cut of beef for sauerbraten? A rump

What is Schnitzel?   Schnitzel is a tender slice of meat, pounded thin, then breaded and fried, giving it a crispy coating. The dish’s name comes from the German word “schnitt,” which translates to “cut.” The most popular type of meat for schnitzel is veal (wiener-schnitzel) or pork (schweine-schnitzel), but there are also varieties made
